files.Title: WSSInterfacing.CoreConfig
files.Summary: Strongly-typed core configuration model persisted in JSON. Exposes the maximum number of WSS devices and the firmware version string.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.CoreConfigController
files.Summary: Controls loading, validating, reading, and writing a stimulation configuration JSON file. Thread-safe. Ensures a valid default config exists on disk.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.DictConfigBase
files.Summary: Base class for JSON-backed configuration objects that expose dotted-key access. Wraps a and provides thread-safe getters/setters and save.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.IBasicStimulation
files.Summary: Basic stimulation operations that upload or select waveforms and manage board configuration. Calls are non-blocking; implementations may enqueue setup steps and return immediately.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.ICoreConfig
files.Summary: Read-only view of core configuration values loaded from the JSON config file. Implementations expose firmware information and global limits.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.IFrameCodec
files.Summary: Contract for framing and deframing WSS messages over byte-stream transports (Serial, BLE, TCP).

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.IModelParamsCore
files.Summary: Model-driven stimulation surface layered over params + core. Extends params API and adds controller-mode stimulation (P/PD).

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.IStimParamsCore
files.Summary: Core + parameters surface layered over . Provides normalized-drive stimulation, per-channel parameter access, and JSON persistence for stimulation parameters. BASIC is optional and can be exposed via .

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.IStimulationCore
files.Summary: Unity-agnostic stimulation core lifecycle and control surface. Implementations manage connection, setup, and a background streaming loop. Public mutators should enqueue edits and return immediately.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.ITransport
files.Summary: Abstraction over a byte-stream transport (e.g., Serial, Bluetooth, TCP) used by the WSS client. Implementations should surface incoming bytes via and provide async connect/disconnect/send operations.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.JsonReader
files.Summary: Lightweight helpers for loading and saving JSON configuration files. Provides typed object and utilities and ensures parent directories exist before writes.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.Log
files.Summary: Minimal logging facade that writes to Unity's console when running inside Unity, and falls back to System.Console on nonâ€‘Unity environments.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.ModelConfig
files.Summary: JSON-backed model configuration that stores controller mode and constants under a dotted-key hierarchy (e.g., "calib.mode", "constants.PModeProportional"). Provides typed access helpers via .

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.ModelConfigController
files.Summary: High-level controller for persistence and keyed access. Paths may be file or directory; if a directory is given, the file name modelConfig.json is used. Dotted keys address JSON nodes, e.g. "calib.mode", "calib.targets.index.threshold".

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.ModelParamsLayer
files.Summary: Model-driven layer (P/PD) that sits on top of an existing params layer. Computes PW from normalized magnitudes and stimulates via the wrapped core.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.SerialPortTransport
files.Summary: Serial-port implementation of for WSS communications. Wraps and exposes an event-driven receive API that works well in Unity/.NET Standard 2.0.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.StimParamsBasicExtensions
files.Summary: Convenience extension methods over that forward to the optional BASIC layer (). These helpers make common operations (waveform upload, shape selection, save/load, requests) concise while preserving the core API surface.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.StimParamsConfig
files.Summary: JSON-backed stimulation-parameters configuration. Inherits common JSON handling from and seeds default per-channel values under the stim.ch hierarchy.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.StimParamsConfigController
files.Summary: Provides high-level access to stimulation parameter configuration. Automatically seeds channel entries based on max WSS count and ensures safe access. Supports only dotted keys of form "stim.ch.{N}.{leaf}".

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.StimParamsLayer
files.Summary: Layer that wraps an and a . Computes pulse widths from normalized inputs and forwards stimulation to the core. Also exposes dotted-key parameter access and an optional BASIC capability.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.Stimulation
files.Summary: High-level Unity wrapper for the full stimulation model layer. Extends StimParamsLayer with proportional and derivative control modes, calibration constants, and model-based drive computation. This is the top-level interface that user code should normally interact with.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.StimulationParams
files.Summary: Unity wrapper that composes a params layer (StimParamsLayer) over a core WSS implementation. Extends the basic interface with per-finger calibration parameters, normalized drive, and JSON persistence. All public stimulation APIs accept a finger string and map to a channel via .

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.Stimulationbasic
files.Summary: Basic Unity MonoBehaviour wrapper for the WSS stimulation core. Handles initialization, configuration, and waveform control for connected WSS stimulators. Designed as the simplest interface layer exposing low-level stimulation functionality.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.TestModeTransport
files.Summary: In-memory transport for debugging and unit tests. No real I/O. Features: artificial latency, jitter, inbound chunking, and drop simulation. Default auto-responder validates checksum, flips sender/target, and echoes or replaces payload.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.WSSLimits
files.Summary: Device- and protocol-level numeric limits and sizes used by the WSS stack. Values reflect firmware constraints such as maximum pulse width and buffer sizes.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.WSSMessageIDs
files.Summary: Protocol message identifiers used by the WSS firmware. Values correspond to on-wire command codes.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.WSSVersionHandler.SupportedVersions
files.Summary: Enum representing known supported WSS firmware versions. Integer values correspond to internal numeric codes.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.WSSVersionHandler
files.Summary: Handles WSS firmware version parsing and feature availability based on supported firmware versions.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.Waveform
files.Summary: Immutable waveform container holding cathodic and anodic shape arrays and the computed total area used for balanced charge calculations.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.WaveformBuilder
files.Summary: Utility for constructing charge-balanced stimulation waveforms. Given a cathodic shape, it computes a matching anodic recharge segment and exposes helpers to retrieve shapes and total area.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.WssClient
files.Summary: Low-level WSS protocol client. Frames commands using an , sends them over an , and correlates responses by (target,msgId). Provides async connect/disconnect and a request/response pipeline used by higher-level cores and layers.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.WssFrameCodec
files.Summary:
WSS frame codec implementing a SLIP-like protocol:

  • END (0xC0) terminates a frame.
  • ESC (0xDB) escapes special bytes inside the frame.
  • END_SUB (0xDC) represents END when escaped.
  • ESC_SUB (0xDD) represents ESC when escaped.
Frames on the wire are [sender][target][payload...][checksum][END]. The checksum is computed over all bytes except the last two (checksum + END).

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.WssStimulationCore
files.Summary: Unity-agnostic WSS stimulation core that manages connection, setup (via a queued step runner), and a background streaming loop. Public mutator methods enqueue device edits and return immediately.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.WssTarget
files.Summary: Addresses for targeting individual WSS units or broadcasting to all. Values are on-wire destination IDs used by commands.

files.Title: WSSInterfacing.portScanner
files.Summary: Simple Unity helper that scans available serial ports and allows selecting one from a UI dropdown to force the COM port used by the stimulation script. Attach this to a separate GameObject and wire the method to a UI event (e.g., button click) to apply the chosen port.
